column4: Problem: I have a RAR file in 4 parts (part1, 2, 3 and 4) and after extraction the file is nowhere to be seen.
you should just extract the first one, if you make your pwd the same as the files you extract, it will extract to the same folder
I extracted the first one and it came out like this: "part1, part1 (1), part1 (2), part1 (3)"
I mean, I extracted them all and they came like that
ls
that's it
one command for most compression files rather than remembering syntax (not hard but the tool makes life easier)
unp Flowers.part1.rar
cheers.
you should read man pages, they tell you more than we ever can
what do you mean with "man pages"?
run:  man unp     and read
ESC or Q to quit, cursors to scroll
you can use: rar x file
unp is just a wrapper command
foo is the file
you are aware there are many guides onlne, have you not researched any?
Sorry I didn't, came here because it's faster
sure but if you can help yourself then you'll learn your OS fastr as well as rely less on others to do menial tasks like this
yes sorry, I was lazy.
dr_willis, oCean, Lasers: Thanks for helping me and sorry for having to deal with me, I'm not used to chatting and can be unpleasant sometimes. Also, how do you "unignore" someone?
which client?
if nobody knows, try asking in #freenode
